name: Instant Pot® 'Pot Roast'
author: Gary Mills
summary: Pot roast in an Instant Pot® with potato, carrots, and celery.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste
3 medium red potatoes, cut into chunks
1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, or as needed
directions: Pat roast dry and season liberally with salt and pepper
Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®), add oil, and select Saute function
Add roast to the hot pot and brown for 5 to 8 minutes per side
Add onion to the pot, adding more oil if needed, and saute until browned, 5 to 7 minutes
Add mushrooms; cook and stir until browned, 3 to 4 more minutes
Add wine and scrape up any browned bits with a wooden spoon
Stir in tomato paste, garlic, and thyme
Place roast on top of the mushrooms and onions
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 80 minutes
Allow 5 to 10 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 15 minutes
Remove roast and vegetables to a bowl
When juices begin to bubble, whisk in flour and cook to thicken, 2 to 3 minutes
